Texas Lakes

Information about sailing on Texas lakes including conditions, boat ramps, and weather.

Central Texas Lakes

Lake Travis

Austin area's premier sailing lake with Austin Yacht Club and multiple marinas. Excellent sailing conditions year-round.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Canyon Lake

Beautiful Hill Country lake with consistent winds and clear water. Home to Lake Canyon Yacht Club.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake LBJ

Protected constant-level lake perfect for learning and recreational sailing. Great for beginners.

Learn More ‚Üí

Lake Buchanan

The largest of the Highland Lakes with wide open sailing and dramatic canyon scenery.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake Medina

Scenic lake west of San Antonio with thermal winds in the afternoons.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake Belton

Central Texas lake with good facilities and sailing access.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

North Texas Lakes

Lake Texoma

Large lake on the Texas-Oklahoma border with excellent sailing and multiple yacht clubs.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake Ray Hubbard

Dallas area lake home to Rush Creek Yacht Club with active racing programs.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake Grapevine

DFW metroplex lake with easy access and good sailing conditions.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Lake Whitney

Scenic lake between Dallas and Austin with thermal winds and beautiful cliffs.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Coastal Sailing

Galveston Bay / Seabrook

Houston area coastal sailing with steady sea breezes. Multiple yacht clubs and marinas.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

Corpus Christi

Year-round sailing with consistent coastal winds. Home to active sailing community.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí

South Padre Island

Excellent windsurfing and dinghy sailing with strong coastal winds.

View Wind Forecast ‚Üí
